alert.note: Alert for Coal; Hughes; Murray; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 16 at 3:51PM CDT until March 16 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Coal County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southern Pontotoc County in east central Oklahoma... Northeastern Murray County in southern Oklahoma... South central Hughes County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 430 PM CDT. * At 351 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Roff, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Emergency management reported golf ball size hail northwest of Sulphur. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Ada, Roff, Stonewall, Tupelo, Fitzhugh, Gerty, Centrahoma, Hickory, Scullin, Fittstown and Jesse. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows!
